intro: Phyllanthus vanderystii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Phyllanthus vanderystii is also noted for its ability to produce a milky latex when its stems or leaves are damaged.
